grantTitle: Second call for innovation studies for the development of generative AI models
grantingOrganization: Fortissimo Plus (FFplus) Project - EuroHPC Joint Undertaking
programName: DIGITAL-EUROHPC-JU-2023-SME-01 Supporting the competitiveness and innovation potential of SMEs
summary: FFplus Call-2-Type-2 provides €4M in funding for innovation studies focused on developing generative AI models using large-scale European HPC resources. The call targets SMEs and startups proficient in generative AI and HPC, supporting 10-month innovation studies with up to €300K per consortium to develop and customize foundation models, LLMs, and other generative AI models for business applications.
objectives: Support SMEs and startups proficient in generative AI and HPC in accessing large-to extreme-scale computing resources
Facilitate and strengthen technological development of European SMEs in generative AI
Enable SMEs to enhance innovation potential by leveraging new generative AI models (LLMs, foundation models)
Demonstrate business benefits of adopting HPC for generative AI model development
Support development and customization of generative AI models using pre-exascale and exascale supercomputers

evaluationCriteria.name: Impact
evaluationCriteria.description: Prospects for innovation, commercial viability, societal relevance, vision of success, value creation/proposition considering SME's business models and exploitation plans, alignment with call objectives
keyIndicators: Vision of success and value proposition

evaluationCriteria.name: Excellence
evaluationCriteria.description: Conceptual and technical excellence including conceptual soundness, cohesiveness, gap-bridging plans, clear technical requirements, justification of technology choices, performance metrics, baseline establishment, and reproducibility
keyIndicators: Plans for bridging gaps to ensure implementation
Performance metrics for model evaluation, scaling, and optimization

evaluationCriteria.name: Implementation
evaluationCriteria.description: Quality of workplan and data management plan, distribution of resources to additional organizations (if applicable), capacity of applicants to carry out proposed work, justification for computational resources required
